newsitem.title: PERU: Peru March customs collections up 4.9 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru March customs collections up 4.9 percent.

text.p: Peru collected $211.5 million in customs duties in March, up nearly five percent from February and 3.5 percent higher than the same month last year, the government's customs agency SUNAD said.
SUNAD said in a statement that it took in $661 million in 1997's first quarter, up 60 percent from $413.2 million collected in the same period last year.
Average daily collections in March reached $11.1 million over 19 working days compared with $9.7 million a day in March 1996, when it took in $204.4 million over 21 days, the statement said.

Customs at Callao, Peru's largest port, collected $141.3 million last month, followed by $39.7 million taken in at Lima's Jorge Chavez international airport and $7.7 million in Mollendo port in the south, it said.
